intro: Lycianthes hispida, commonly known as the rough lycianthes, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough texture, and the fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature. This plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its distinctive appearance and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
